title: FUNGALZSL: ZERO-SHOT FUNGAL CLASSIFICATION WITH IMAGE CAPTIONING USING A SYNTHETIC DATA APPROACH
author: Anju Rani (Aalborg University Esbjerg, Denmark), Daniel O. Arroyo (Aalborg University Esbjerg, Denmark), Petar Durdevic (Aalborg University Esbjerg, Denmark), ...
relevance_why: The paper explores zero-shot classification methods using synthetic datasets, which could inspire novel applications of generative models in audio or multimodal domains. Concepts of image-text alignment may translate into new techniques in audio-text alignment for audio generation tasks.
background: Utilizing large vision-language models for classifying unseen fungal growth stages using text descriptions and synthetic image datasets.
contribution: This paper introduces synthetic fungi images and text generated by language models to improve zero-shot classification performance of fungal growth stages, achieving enhanced model accuracy.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods typically rely on manually curated datasets for classification tasks, limiting their ability to adapt to new classes without retraining.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work generates synthetic datasets and uses LLMs to create diverse text descriptions, bridging modality gaps for improved classification without additional data collection.

key_innovation: The integration of synthetic image generation with diverse language model outputs to enhance classification in a specialized domain.
real_world_impact: The approach could streamline the identification of diverse fungi in ecological monitoring and agricultural practices, thereby aiding in biodiversity studies.
limitations: The accuracy may vary based on the quality of text descriptions generated by different language models, and overlap between fungal growth stages can lead to misclassifications.

new_terms.zero-shot classification: **Zero-shot classification** refers to the ability of a model to predict classes for which it has not seen training examples.
new_terms.synthetic dataset: **Synthetic dataset** is a dataset generated algorithmically, rather than collected from real-world observations, allowing for the creation of expansive and diversified data without the need for manual labeling.

open_sourcing: Synthetic Fungi Generation dataset is available at [Synthetic Fungi Generation](https://data.mendeley.com/datasets/rw6ndgyrd7/1).
